catalogue_raissonne: Seth Eastman: A Portfolio of North American Indians 14
creditline: Gift of the W. Duncan and Nivin MacMillan Foundation
inscription:
Title and Inscription

Lower center, below image, in black ink: [FALLS of ST. ANTHONY]
provenance: James J. Hill (St. Paul, 1838-1916); his estate; James Jerome Hill Reference Library St. Paul (by 1921-1994; sold October, to MacMillan); W. Duncan MacMillan, Wayzata (1994-d. 2006); the W. Duncan and Nivin MacMillan Foundation (2006-2014; given to MIA)
signed: LL, below image, in brown ink: [Capt. S. Eastman U.S. Army Del.]
text: Seth Eastman created this watercolor to illustrate the tale of Anpetu Sapawin, or Dark Day. She was so upset about her husband having a second wife that she took her baby and paddled to her death over St. Anthony Falls in present-day Minneapolis (shown here from the south). The work was reproduced in an 1852 publication called “The Iris.”
title: Falls of St. Anthony
